metadata.title: CVE-2018-14734 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
drivers/infiniband/core/ucma.c in the Linux kernel through 4.17.11 allowsucma_leave_multicast to access a certain data structure after a cleanupstep in ucma_process_join, which allows attackers to cause a denial ofservice (use-after-free).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-14734` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-164-generic - 3.13.0-164.214
linux-image-3.13.0-164-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-164.214
linux-image-3.13.0-164-lowlatency - 3.13.0-164.214
linux-image-3.13.0-164-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-164.214
linux-image-3.13.0-164-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-164.214
linux-image-3.13.0-164-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-164.214
linux-image-3.13.0-164-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-164.214
linux-image-3.13.0-164-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-164.214
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-164-generic - 3.13.0-164.214
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-138-generic - 4.4.0-138.164~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-138-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-138.164~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-138-lowlatency - 4.4.0-138.164~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-138-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-138.164~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-138-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-138.164~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-138-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-138.164~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-138-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-138.164~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-138-generic - 4.4.0-138.164~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1032-aws - 4.4.0-1032.35
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1036-azure - 4.15.0-1036.38~14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-164.214').
